creator: sean@corfield.org
text:
I was using ant 1.7.1 to <get> a URL that responded with Location: index.cfm?event=auth.login and it was correctly following the redirect by prepending the base URL (http://dev.mysite/).

I upgraded to ant 1.8.0 and the <get> now fails, reporting:

build.xml:436: The following error occurred while executing this line:
build.xml:444: java.net.MalformedURLException: no protocol: index.cfm?event=auth.login
	at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:566)
	at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:463)
	at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:412)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Get$GetThread.openConnection(Get.java:676)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Get$GetThread.get(Get.java:581)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Get$GetThread.run(Get.java:571)

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: should be fixed with svn revision 932445 but unfortunately I have a hard time to get an automated test to work (this is an infrastructure issue more than anything else).  It would be good if you could confirm the fix.
It would be great if you could give the version that is supposed to become 1.8.1 in http://people.apache.org/~antoine/dist/ a try.
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
I can confirm that my build file runs perfectly with that 1.8.1 distro. It prints out messages about redirects in URLs that it <get>s and it even handles jsessionid in the middle of a URL now:

location: index.cfm;jsessionid=26C533226ACC3C414FF9BCB7B65CD4A8?event=auth.login

      [get] http://dvadmin.my-test.com/?fwreinit=ws92656 moved to index.cfm;jsessionid=56307BB08FB1CD9BD7721AC9F7B8B422?event=auth.login

Looks good. Thanx Stefan!
